events.originalText: British prime minister Theresa May invoked Article 50 of the Treaty on European Union, formally beginning the United Kingdom's withdrawal from the European Union.
events.subtitle: Theresa May
events.headline: Theresa May triggers Brexit with Article 50 invocation

events.originalText: The first same-sex marriages in England and Wales took place following the passage of the Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Act 2013.
events.subtitle: Same-sex marriage in the United Kingdom
events.headline: First same-sex marriages in England and Wales take place

events.originalText: Islamist separatists of the Caucasus Emirate detonated two bombs on the Moscow Metro, killing 40 people and injuring 102 others.
events.subtitle: Caucasus Emirate
events.headline: Islamist separatists detonate bombs on Moscow Metro, 40 killed

events.originalText: The strongest earthquake to hit the foothills of the Himalayas in more than 90 years killed at least 100 people.
events.subtitle: 1999 Chamoli earthquake
events.headline: Deadly earthquake hits Himalayas, at least 100 dead

events.originalText: Queen Elizabeth II granted royal assent to the Canada Act 1982, which ended any remaining constitutional dependence of Canada on the United Kingdom by a process known as patriation.
events.subtitle: Elizabeth II
events.headline: Queen Elizabeth II grants royal assent to Canada Act 1982

events.originalText: Dick Beardsley and Inge Simonsen jointly won the Men's Elite Race and Joyce Smith won the Women's Elite Race in the inaugural London Marathon.
events.subtitle: Dick Beardsley
events.headline: Dick Beardsley and Inge Simonsen win Men's Elite Race in London Marathon

events.originalText: Jeff Beck released Blow by Blow, his most successful album in the U.S., reaching the top five and selling over one million copies.
events.subtitle: Jeff Beck
events.headline: Jeff Beck releases successful album 'Blow by Blow'

events.originalText: NASA's Mariner 10, launched in November 1973, became the first space probe to fly by the planet Mercury.
events.subtitle: NASA
events.headline: NASA's Mariner 10 becomes first space probe to fly by Mercury

events.originalText: A group of farmers in Shaanxi province, China, discovered a vast collection of terracotta statues (pictured) depicting the armies of the first Emperor of China Qin Shi Huang.
events.subtitle: Shaanxi
events.headline: Farmers in China discover terracotta army statues

events.originalText: The New People's Army, the armed wing of the Communist Party of the Philippines, was formed.
events.subtitle: New People's Army
events.headline: New People's Army, armed wing of Communist Party of the Philippines, formed

events.originalText: The King and I, a musical about Mongkut of Siam,  by Rodgers and Hammerstein premiered on Broadway.
events.subtitle: The King and I
events.headline: Rodgers and Hammerstein's 'The King and I' premieres on Broadway

events.originalText: The North American Regional Broadcasting Agreement to define technical standards for AM band radio stations came into effect.
events.subtitle: North American Regional Broadcasting Agreement
events.headline: North American Regional Broadcasting Agreement comes into effect

events.originalText: Second World War: British and Australian ships defeated Italian Regia Marina vessels at the Battle of Cape Matapan.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: British and Australian ships defeat Italian vessels at Battle of Cape Matapan

events.originalText: The Knights of Columbus, the world's largest Catholic fraternal service organization, was founded by Michael J. McGivney in New Haven, Connecticut, U.S.
events.subtitle: Knights of Columbus
events.headline: Knights of Columbus founded in New Haven, Connecticut

events.originalText: American Civil War: The Appomattox campaign opened with the Battle of Lewis's Farm, in which the Confederate Army of Northern Virginia was forced into a series of retreats that would culminate in their surrender.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Appomattox campaign opens with Battle of Lewis's Farm

events.originalText: The first edition of The Irish Times was published.
events.subtitle: The Irish Times
events.headline: First edition of The Irish Times published

events.originalText: German astronomer Heinrich Wilhelm Matthias Olbers discovered Vesta, the brightest asteroid and second-most massive body in the asteroid belt.
events.subtitle: Heinrich Wilhelm Matthias Olbers
events.headline: Astronomer discovers asteroid Vesta in asteroid belt

events.originalText: William Matthews was ordained as the first British America-born Catholic priest.
events.subtitle: William Matthews (priest)
events.headline: William Matthews ordained as first British America-born Catholic priest

events.originalText: During the Wars of the Roses, Yorkist troops defeated Lancastrian forces at the Battle of Towton in Yorkshire, England, one of the largest land battles ever fought in England.
events.subtitle: Wars of the Roses
events.headline: Yorkist troops defeat Lancastrian forces at Battle of Towton

events.originalText: After an eight-year siege, the Ottoman Empire captured the city of Thessalonica from the Republic of Venice.
events.subtitle: Siege of Thessalonica (1422–1430)
events.headline: Ottoman Empire captures Thessalonica from Republic of Venice

events.originalText: Viking expansion: Viking raiders, possibly led by the legendary Ragnar Lodbrok, plundered and occupied Paris (depicted), holding the city for a large ransom.
events.subtitle: Viking expansion
events.headline: Viking raiders plunder and occupy Paris
